sen.j: 坂東 三津五郎（ばんどう みつごろう）は、歌舞伎役者の名跡。
sen.e: Mitsugoro BANDO is a myoseki (professional name) of kabuki actor.
Mitsugoro BANDO is a Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors) actor's professional name.
Mitsugoro BANDO is a Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors) actor's professional name.

sen.j: 屋号は大和屋 (歌舞伎)。
sen.e: Its yago (stage family name) is Yamatoya (kabuki).
The stage family name is Yamatoya.
sen.cmt: 表現を合わせました。原文には「（歌舞伎）」とありますが、リンク先の単語が抽出されるバグのようですので、訳出しておりません。
sen.e: The stage family name is Yamatoya.

sen.j: 家紋は三ツ大（みつだい）、替紋は花勝見（はなかつみ）。
sen.e: Its kamon (family crest) is Mitsudai, and its kaemon (alternate kamon) is Hanakatsumi.
The Jomon (family crest) is Mitsudai (literally, three 'dai' of Chinese characters) and the Kaemon (alternate personal crest) is Hanakatsumi (literally, Katsumi [an iris] flower).
sen.cmt: 表現を合わせ、用語補足しました。
sen.e: The Jomon (family crest) is Mitsudai (literally, three 'dai' of Chinese characters) and the Kaemon (alternate personal crest) is Hanakatsumi (literally, Katsumi [an iris] flower).

sen.j: 初代坂東三八（ばんどう さんや）の養子。
sen.e: He was an adopted son of the first Sanya BANDO.
He was an adopted son of the first Sanya BANDO.
He was an adopted son of the first Sanya BANDO.

sen.j: 晩年は初代の実の子に三津五郎の名を譲り二代目荻野伊三郎を名乗る。
sen.e: He handed over the name of Mitsugoro to the son of the first in his last days and called himself the second Isaburo OGINO.
He handed over the name of Mitsugoro to the biological son of the first in his last days and called himself the second Isaburo OGINO.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: He handed over the name of Mitsugoro to the biological son of the first in his last days and called himself the second Isaburo OGINO.

sen.j: 初代の子。
sen.e: He was a son of the first.
He was a son of the first.
He was a son of the first.

sen.j: 江戸・文化 (日本)文政期を代表する名優。
sen.e: He was a great actor representing the Bunka/Bunsei era of Edo period (Japan).
He was a great actor representing the Bunka-Bunsei eras (from 1804 to 1829) of Edo period (Japan).
He was a great actor representing the Bunka-Bunsei eras (from 1804 to 1829) of Edo period (Japan).

sen.j: 住所から「永木の親方」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: He was called "Eiki no oyakata" because of his adress.
He was called 'Eiki no oyakata' (Master in Eiki) because of his address.
He was called 'Eiki no oyakata' (Master in Eiki) because of his address.

sen.j: 中風にかかり、体が不自由になって以後も舞台に上がったので、ヨイヨイから「ヨイ三津」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: As he appeared on stage even after he was stricken with paralysis and became disabled, so called yoi-you, he was called "Yoi-Mitsu".
As he appeared on stage even after he was stricken with paralysis and became disabled, so called yoi-yoi, he was called 'Yoi-Mitsu' (literally, physically challenged Mitsugoro).
As he appeared on stage even after he was stricken with paralysis and became disabled, so called yoi-yoi, he was called 'Yoi-Mitsu' (literally, physically challenged Mitsugoro).

sen.j: 実の兄は落語家の初代金原亭馬生。
sen.e: His older brother was the first Basho KINGENTEI, a comic storyteller.
His older brother was the first Basho KINGENTEI, a Rakugo (traditional comic storytelling) storyteller.
His older brother was the first Basho KINGENTEI, a Rakugo (traditional comic storytelling) storyteller.

sen.j: 市村座の帳元橘屋治助の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son of Jisuke Tachibanaya, the chomoto (manager) of Ichimura-za theater.
He was the second son of Jisuke TACHIBANAYA, the chomoto (manager) of Ichimura-za theater.
He was the second son of Jisuke TACHIBANAYA, the chomoto (manager) of Ichimura-za theater.

sen.j: 三代目坂東三津五郎の養子
sen.e: He was an adopted son of the third Mitsugoro BANDO.
He was an adopted son of the third Mitsugoro BANDO.
He was an adopted son of the third Mitsugoro BANDO.

sen.j: 女形ながら痘痕で顔にあばたがあったので「あば三津」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: As he had a pock-marked face (abatazura) while being onnagata (female-role actor), he was called "Aba-mitsu".
As he had abatazura (a pock-marked face) while being onnagata (female-role actor), he was called 'Aba-mitsu' (Mitsugoro with Abatazura face).
sen.cmt: 用語補足等をしました。
sen.e: As he had abatazura (a pock-marked face) while being onnagata (female-role actor), he was called 'Aba-mitsu' (Mitsugoro with Abatazura face).

sen.j: 守田勘弥 (12代目)の子。
sen.e: He was a son of Kanya MORITA.
He was a son of Kanya MORITA (the 12th).
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「12代目」を補足しました。
sen.e: He was a son of Kanya MORITA (the 12th).

sen.j: 前名二代目坂東八十助。
sen.e: His former name was the second Yasosuke BAMDO.
His former name was the second Yasosuke BANDO.
His former name was the second Yasosuke BANDO.

sen.j: 日本舞踊坂東流の家元。
sen.e: He was the head of Bando-ryu school of Classical Japanese dance.
He was the head of Bando-ryu school of Classical Japanese dance.
He was the head of Bando-ryu school of Classical Japanese dance.

sen.j: 「踊りの神さま」と称される。
sen.e: He was called "the Deity of Dance".
He was called 'the God of Dance.'
He was called 'the God of Dance.'

sen.j: 七代目の養子。
sen.e: He was an adopted son of the seventh.
He was an adopted son of the seventh.
He was an adopted son of the seventh.

sen.j: 前名六代目坂東蓑助。
sen.e: His former name was the sixth Minosuke BANDO.
His former name was the sixth Minosuke BANDO.
His former name was the sixth Minosuke BANDO.

sen.j: 人間国宝。
sen.e: He was designated as Living National Treasure.
He was designated as Living National Treasure.
He was designated as Living National Treasure.

sen.j: 京都の料理屋で食べたふぐの中毒で急死。
sen.e: He died suddenly due to globefish poison after he ate a globefish at a restaurant in Kyoto.
He died suddenly due to globefish poison after he ate a globefish at a restaurant in Kyoto.
He died suddenly due to globefish poison after he ate a globefish at a restaurant in Kyoto.

sen.j: 八代目の長女の婿養子。
sen.e: He was the husband of the oldest daughter of the eighth.
He was the husband of the oldest daughter of the eighth.
He was the husband of the oldest daughter of the eighth.

sen.j: 坂東秀調 (3代目)の三男。
sen.e: He was the third son of Shucho BANDO (the third).
He was the third son of Shucho BANDO (the third).
He was the third son of Shucho BANDO (the third).

sen.j: 前名七代目坂東蓑助。
sen.e: His former name was the seventh Minosuke BANDO.
His former name was the seventh Minosuke BANDO.
His former name was the seventh Minosuke BANDO.

tit.cmt: アラビア数字にしました。

sen.j: 九代目の長男、当代。
sen.e: He is the oldest son of the ninth and current Mitsugoro BANDO.
He is the oldest son of the ninth and current Mitsugoro BANDO.
He is the oldest son of the ninth and current Mitsugoro BANDO.

sen.j: 前名五代目坂東八十助。
sen.e: His former name was the fifth Yasosuke BANDO.
He formerly called himself the fifth Yasosuke BANDO.
He formerly called himself the fifth Yasosuke BANDO.
